title: Hong Kong stock exchange boss says protesters are wrong to demand political rights
text:
The head of the Hong Kong stock market has attracted criticism after questioning the troubled territory's fight to maintain political freedoms from mainland China, just weeks after abandoning a shock attempt to buy the London Stock Exchange for £32bn.

Speaking at the annual dinner of the London Metal Exchange on Tuesday, Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing chief Charles Li, said the “one country, two systems” model which gives the city a degree of independence but keeps it subservient to Communist China had “fundamental flaws.”

It follows months of pro-democracy protests which have sparked an increasingly brutal crackdown by the authorities.
